indicator_name: Proportion of water samples non-compliant with hygienic standards for sanitary-chemical and microbiological parameters
graph_title: Proportion of water samples non-compliant with hygienic standards for sanitary-chemical and microbiological parameters
goal_name: 6.Ensure availability and sustainable management of water and sanitation for all
target_name: 6.1 By 2030, achieve universal and equitable access to safe and affordable drinking water for all
indicator_name1: 6.1.1.1 Proportion of water samples that do not meet hygiene standards
organization_name: The National Statistical Committee of the Kyrgyz Republic (Social Statistics Unit)
definitions: This indicator represents the proportion of drinking water samples that deviate from national quality standards in the total number of drinking water samples taken from various sources (water supply companies, open water intakes, groundwater).
rationale_interpretation: This indicator makes it possible to assess the degree of contamination of drinking water with chemicals and microbiological organisms. This indicator allows you to determine the risk of negative effects of poor-quality drinking water on human health, and also characterizes the degree of compliance of drinking water with national sanitary requirements and standards.Public access to clean drinking water is of paramount importance in reducing the risk of exposure to polluted waters, and in particular the possibility of infection and related diseases. Additionally, the relationship of this indicator with other socio-economic characteristics, as well as its contribution to assessing the level of general hygiene and quality of life, make it a universal indicator of human development.
data_sources: The NSC calculates the proportion of water samples that do not meet hygienic standards (Sanitary condition of water bodies in places of public water use) according to the data provided by the Ministry of Health's DPGSEN based on the state statistical Reporting form No. 18 "Report on the work of the Center for State Sanitary and Epidemiological Surveillance."
data_collection: "The Department of Disease Prevention and State Sanitary and Epidemiological Supervision of the Ministry of Health of the Kyrgyz Republic monitors the quality of drinking water on both urban, regional and national scales. Sample collection is carried out using an approved network and with a certain frequency. Microbiological and physico-chemical analysis is performed. The indicator is calculated based on the available number of drinking water samples that do not meet national quality standards in relation to the total number of drinking water samples. The Kyrgyz integrated hydrogeological expedition of the GKPEN is conducting a survey of water intake facilities, both complexes and single wells and springs, including water quality."
computation_methods: The proportion of samples exceeding national standards can be calculated using the formula: % of samples exceeding national standards =(number of samples exceeding standards/ total number of samples)
international_comparability: WHO Guidelines on Drinking Water Quality Control (fourth edition). The EU Drinking Water Directive (98/83/EC) sets values for 48 of the most common parameters based on WHO guidelines. Guidelines for Setting Targets, assessing progress and reporting under the Protocol on Water and Health, ECE 2010.
